com.github.i49.hibiscus.schema

Interface Schema

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SchemaImpl

    public interface Schema
    A schema which describes constraints on the structure and the content of JSON documents to be validated. This object is the top level component for any schema to be built.

    An instance of a schema can be created through SchemaComponents.schema(). The following code shows a sample schema which requires a JSON object at the root of JSON documents.

    
 import static com.github.i49.hibiscus.schema.SchemaComponents.*;
 Schema t = schema(object());
    See Also:
    SchemaComponents

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      TypeSet getTypeSet()
      Returns the set of JsonTypes allowed to be at the root of JSON documents.
      Schema types(JsonType... types)
      Specifies all JsonTypes allowed to be at the root of JSON documents.

    • Method Detail

      • types

        Schema types(JsonType... types)
        Specifies all JsonTypes allowed to be at the root of JSON documents.

        If this method is called multiple times on the same instance, all previously declared types are not preserved and removed from this schema.

        Parameters:
        types - the JsonTypes allowed to be at the root of JSON documents. Each type must have a unique TypeId and cannot be null.
        Returns:
        this schema.
        Throws:
        SchemaException - if one of types given has the same TypeId as others or null.

      • getTypeSet

        TypeSet getTypeSet()
        Returns the set of JsonTypes allowed to be at the root of JSON documents.
        Returns:
        the set of JsonTypes allowed to be at the root of JSON documents.
        See Also:
        types(com.github.i49.hibiscus.schema.JsonType...)
